> ðŸš§ Some functions of the Route Plan (List View) operate differently from those in the Route Plan (Map View)

## Route Plan Definition

* Route Plan is the delivery plan generated by Abivin vRoute that consists of the Optimized Routes of all Sales Orders of a particular Branch on a specific date. A Route Plan will cover the following points:
* 1 - Which vehicles will be utilized
* 2 - How the Orders will be allocated to the vehicles
* 3 - The optimized Delivery Routes of the vehicles

## Switching between Route Plan Map View and Route Plan List View

### 1.1. Necessary set-up to use Route Plan both in Map View and List View

* Users can now use Route Plan Map View and Route Plan List View at the same time. To do this, please follow these steps:
* Step 1: Navigate to tab **Organizations > Organizations**. Click the icon :fa-pencil: in the Edit column to edit information of **Manufacturer**. You can refer to the column **Organization Categories** to see what type of organization you chose is.

<Image title="1. Route List (ENG).png" alt={1903} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/0bba665-1._Route_List_ENG.png">
  Illustration (English)
</Image>

<Image title="1. Route List (VIE).png" alt={1898} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/c8fef1f-1._Route_List_VIE.png">
  Illustration (Vietnamese)
</Image>

* Step 2: In the form named **Update Organization**, select the tab **More Configurations**. On the left of the form, select **Route** then tick the box **Show Route List View**

<Image title="2. Route List (ENG).png" alt={1920} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/746ebfc-2._Route_List_ENG.png">
  Illustration (English)
</Image>

<Image title="2. Route List (VIE).png" alt={1916} src="https://files.readme.io/0ee9ea4-2._Route_List_VIE.png">
  Illustration (Vietnamese)
</Image>

* Step 3: Click **Save** for changes to take effects. 
* Only when you turn on the configuration **Show Route List View** for Manufacturer are you able to use Route Plan Map View and Route Plan List View at the same time. If you don't turn on this configuration, you will only see Route Plan Map View
* Furthermore, please make sure you have assigned the User Group the right to use both List View and Map View. For more information, please refer to this link 

### 1.2. Planning Screen

After you turn on the configuration **Show Route List View** and assign the right to view route plan in List view and Map view, you will see a tab named **Planning** on the menu to the left of the screen.

* The Planning Screen will show the following information
* Route Plan Code
* Branch Code
* Branch Name
* Route Plan Date
* Column **Edit**
* The Planning screen will show no information if there is no optimized route plan.

<Image title="5. Planning Screen (ENG).png" alt={1920} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/8eedf8d-5._Planning_Screen_ENG.png">
  Illustration (English)
</Image>

<Image title="5. Planning Screen (VIE).png" alt={1920} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/15d5951-5._Planning_Screen_VIE.png">
  Illustration (Vietnamese)
</Image>

* In case there is any optimized route plan, under the column **Edit**
* Click the icon :fa-eye: to see the route plan in List View
* Click the icon :fa-leanpub: to see the route plan in Map View

<Image title="4. Planning Module.png" alt={1920} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/50504f1-4._Planning_Module.png">
  Illustration (English)
</Image>

<Image title="4. Planning Module (VIE).png" alt={1920} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/d23bc73-4._Planning_Module_VIE.png">
  Illustration (Vietnamese)
</Image>

* To get back to the screen Planning, click the button Back :fa-arrow-left:. The button is to the left of the Branch Name in the Map View.

<Image title="1. Back (ENG).gif" alt={1920} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/be542df-1._Back_ENG.gif">
  Illustration (English)
</Image>

<Image title="1. Back (VIE).gif" alt={1920} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/386d3ef-1._Back_VIE.gif">
  Illustration (Vietnamese)
</Image>

### 1.3. Switching from Map View Screen to List View Screen

* Click the icon :fa-list: to change from Map View Screen to List View Screen. The icon is to the right of the Branch Name in the Map View

<Image title="2. Switch 3.gif" alt={1920} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/361967c-2._Switch_3.gif">
  Illustration (English)
</Image>

<Image title="2. Switch 2.gif" alt={1920} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/da81329-2._Switch_2.gif">
  Illustration (Vietnamese)
</Image>

### 1.4. Switching from List View Screen to Map View Screen

* Click the icon  :fa-leanpub: to change from List View Screen to Map View Screen

<Image title="2. Switch 4.gif" alt={1920} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/8703ed8-2._Switch_4.gif">
  Illustration (English)
</Image>

<Image title="2. Switch 1.gif" alt={1920} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/676dc1c-2._Switch_1.gif">
  Illustration (Vietnamese)
</Image>

## Route Plan Optimization process

* Typically, a Route Plan optimization process on the List view consists of the following phases:
* Phase 1: Generate Route Plan
* Phase 2: Optimize Route Plan
* Phase 3: Lock Route Plan
* Phase 4: Finalize locked Route Plan
* Phase 5: Synchronize finalized Route Plan (**Note**: This phase is only required for certain user accounts who use external Transportation management systems - TMS)
* (Optional - Linked with Phase 5) Manually close Route Plan

## Phase 1: Generate Route Plan

* To generate a Route Plan, follow the steps below:
* Step 1: Navigate to tab **Planning**
* **Note**: The screen might occasionally appear blank. You need to refresh the page (Use the key combination **Ctrl R** or right click on the screen then click **Reload** on the menu) if that happens
* Step 2: On this tab, hover your mouse over the yellow plus-circle icon :fa-plus-circle: then click on the icon **Create** :fa-pencil:
* Step 3: The **Create Route Plan** form will appear
* Step 4: On this form, click on the field **Branch** then select the appropriate Branch from the drop-down list
* Step 5: Click on the calendar icon :fa-calendar-o: of the field **Date**. On the drop-down calendar, select the appropriate date on which you want to generate the Route Plan. The selected date here equals the **Order Date** attribute of the Sales Orders
* Step 6: Click on the **Confirm** button
* The system will immediately generate a Route Plan of the selected Branch on the selected date. The newly created Route Plan will appear in the Route Plan table below

<Image title="7. Route List (ENG).gif" alt={1920} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/5bb068d-7._Route_List_ENG.gif">
  Illustration (English)
</Image>

## Phase 2: Optimize Route Plan

* The Route Plan generated in Phase 1 has not yet been optimized. To optimize it, follow the steps below:
* Step 1: Click on the icon :fa-eye: of the recently created Route Plan (Under the **Edit** column). You will be directed to the screen **Route Plan Detail**
* Step 2: On this screen, click on the **Optimize** button on the popup named **Optimize Route**
* The system will start the Route Plan optimization process. After a few moments, the optimized Route Plan will appear in the Route Plan table below

<Image title="7. Route List 2 (ENG).gif" alt={1920} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/bd20455-7._Route_List_2_ENG.gif">
  Illustration (English)
</Image>

* During this phase, while the Planning Status of the Delivery Shifts is still ***Planned***, not yet ***Locked***, you can make adjustments to those Delivery Routes. The details will be covered in the following section: [**Route Plan Adjustments**](https://docs.abivin.com/docs/vrp-in-house-fleet-route-plan-list-view#section-route-plan-adjustment)

## Phase 3: Lock Optimized Route Plan

* After you have made necessary adjustments to the Route Plan, you can lock the optimized Delivery Shifts inside that Route Plan
* Step 1: To select a Delivery Shift, click on the corresponding checkbox icon :fa-square-o: of that Delivery Shift. You can select multiple Delivery Shifts. You can also select all Delivery Shifts of all vehicles in the current Route Plan by clicking on the checkbox icon :fa-square-o: on the column title bar
* Step 2: After you have selected the appropriate Delivery Shifts, click on the **Lock Route** button located above the top right corner of the Route Plan table
* Step 3: As you click on this button, a confirmation dialog box will appear. Click on the **Confirm** button to confirm locking the selected Delivery Shifts
* After the selected Delivery Shifts have been locked, their Planning Status will update from ***Planned*** to ***Locked***

<Image title="2. Route List Optimized (ENG) 1.gif" alt={1920} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/2326577-2._Route_List_Optimized_ENG_1.gif">
  Lock Route (English Illustration)
</Image>

<Image title="2. ROute List Optimized (VIE) 2.gif" alt={1920} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/c8c6510-2._ROute_List_Optimized_VIE_2.gif">
  Lock Route (Vietnamese Illustration)
</Image>

* At this phase, you can still unlock the locked Delivery Shifts. To do that, select those Delivery Shifts then click the **Unlock Route** button located above the top right corner of the Route Plan table. After unlocking, the Planning Status of those Delivery Shifts will revert from ***Locked*** back to ***Planned***

<Image title="3. Unlock Route (ENG).png" alt={1900} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/94482fa-3._Unlock_Route_ENG.png">
  Illustration (English)
</Image>

<Image title="3. Unlock Route (VIE).png" alt={1898} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/9356a14-3._Unlock_Route_VIE.png">
  Illustration (Vietnamese)
</Image>

## Phase 4: Finalize Locked Route Plan

* After the following events happen:
* 1. The Delivery Shifts of the vehicles have been locked on the Abivin vRoute system, **and**
* 2. The delivery vehicles have actually finished loading products at the manufacturing warehouses and are about to begin their assigned Delivery tasks; you need to finalize those locked Delivery Shifts. 
* **Note** Once a locked Delivery Shift has been finalized, you can not revert that Delivery Shift back to ***Locked*** status.
* To finalize a locked Delivery Shift, follow the steps below
* Step 1: On the **Route Plan Details** screen, navigate to the **Plan** tab
* Step 2: On this tab, select the locked Delivery Shifts which you want to finalize, then click on the **Finalize** button located above the top right corner of the Route Plan table 
* After a few moments, the selected locked Delivery Shifts will be finalized. Their Planning Status will update from ***Locked*** to ***Finalized***

<Image title="4. Finalize (ENG).gif" alt={1920} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/1688c5d-4._Finalize_ENG.gif">
  Finalize Locked Route (English)
</Image>

<Image title="4. Finalize (VIE).gif" alt={1920} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/c8ac47c-4._Finalize_VIE.gif">
  Finalize Locked Route (Vietnamese)
</Image>

## Phase 5: Synchronize finalized Route Plan to the external Transportation Management System (TMS)

> ðŸ“˜ This phase is only required for certain user accounts who use external TMS

* Right after you have finalized a locked Delivery Shift, you need to synchronize that Delivery Shift from Abivin vRoute system to the external TMS
* To do that, follow the step below
* Step 1: On the **Route Plan Details** screen, navigate to the **Execution** tab
* Step 2: Click on the checkbox icon :fa-square-o: of the finalized Delivery Shift you want to synchronize to select it
* Step 3: Click on the **Sync** button located above the top right corner of the Route Plan table. The synchronization status of the finalized Delivery Shift (Under the **Sync Status** column) will update from ***No*** to ***Yes*** once the synchronization process completes

<Image title="Synchronize Route.gif" alt={1920} src="https://files.readme.io/d31fda1-Synchronize_Route.gif">
  Synchronize Route (English)
</Image>

<Image title="Synchronize Route (Vietnamese).gif" alt={1920} src="https://files.readme.io/5f2fff3-Synchronize_Route_Vietnamese.gif">
  Synchronize Route (Vietnamese)
</Image>

## (Optional) Manually Close Route Plan

> ðŸ“˜ This phase is only required for certain user accounts who use external TMS, and can be performed after Phase 5

* After the following events happen:
* 1. A Delivery Shift has been finalized and synchronized to the external TMS **and**
* 2. The delivery vehicles have actually performed the Delivery Shifts, but the external TMS has yet to forward the delivery result back to Abivin vRoute system then you can manually close that Delivery Shift on the Abivin vRoute system. By closing a finalized Delivery Shift, the vehicle that has been used to perform that Delivery Shift will be released and can be utilized in other Route Plan Optimization processes in the future
* To manually close a Delivery Shift (**Note**: Synchronized Delivery Shifts can also be closed), follow the steps below:
* Step 1: On the **Route Plan Details** screen, navigate to the **Execution** tab
* Step 2: Click the checkbox icon :fa-square-o: of the finalized Delivery Shift you want to manually close to select it
* Step 3: Click the **Close Trip** button located above the top right corner of the Route Plan table
* Step 4: Upon clicking, a confirmation message will appear. Click the **Confirm** button on that message
* After clicking over at the **Transportation** > **Vehicle List** tab, the **Vehicle Status** of the vehicle will update from ***Locked*** to ***Open***

<Image title="Close Trip (ENG).gif" alt={1920} src="https://files.readme.io/0cf03d4-Close_Trip_ENG.gif">
  Close Trips Manually (English)
</Image>

<Image title="Close Route (VIE).gif" alt={1920} src="https://files.readme.io/91bcf31-Close_Route_VIE.gif">
  Close Trips Manually (Vietnamese)
</Image>

## Route Plan Adjustments

> â—ï¸ Prevent concurrent actions of multiple users on the Route Plan (List View)
>
> * As of the [**June 08th, 2021 release**](https://docs.abivin.com/changelog/june-08-2021-release-notes), we have implemented a mechanism to prevent multiple users from modifying a specific Route Plan at the same time
> * If you try to modify a Route Plan that is being modified by another user, the system will display this warning message: ***Another user is taking action on this Route Plan!***
> * If you try to modify a Route Plan that is not yet up-to-date because it was recently modified by another user, the system will display this notification: ***This Route Plan has just been modified by another user. You can only take action after reloading the screen. You need to click OK to reload the screen and get the most up-to-date Route Plan***

## Re-Optimize not yet locked/unlocked Delivery Shifts

* If a Delivery Shift is not yet locked or has been unlocked, you can make changes to the elements of that Delivery Shift (Such as Products, Vehicles, Orders, Customers, etc.)
* After making the necessary changes, you need to re-optimize those Delivery Shifts in order for the system to take into account the changes you have just made. To do that, follow the steps below:
* Step 1: Navigate to the **Route Plan Details** screen
* Step 2: Click the **Optimize** button again
* Upon clicking, the system will start the Route Plan optimization process again. The Delivery Shifts will be reoptimized and will take into account the changes you have made

## Unlock locked Delivery Shift

* After a Delivery Shift has been locked, you can unlock it following the steps below:
* Step 1: Click on the checkbox icon :fa-square-o: of the locked Delivery Shift to select it
* Step 2: Click on the **Unlock Route** button located above the top right corner of the Route Plan table
* Step 3: A confirmation message will appear. On that message, click on the **Confirm** button
* The system will unlock the selected locked Delivery Shift. After unlocking, the Planning Status of the locked Delivery Shift will revert from ***Locked*** back to ***Planned***

<Image title="Unlock Route (English).gif" alt={1920} src="https://files.readme.io/ed97b81-Unlock_Route_English.gif">
  Unlock Route (English Illustration)
</Image>

<Image title="Unlock Route (Vietnamese).gif" alt={1920} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/3197d0b-Unlock_Route_Vietnamese.gif">
  Unlock Route (Vietnamese Illustration)
</Image>

## Change Vehicle of Planned Delivery Shift

* When the Planning Status of a particular Delivery Shift is still ***Planned***, not yet ***Locked***, you can assign another vehicle to perform that Delivery Shift. The detailed steps are described below
* Step 1: Drag the horizontal scrollbar to the far right of the Route Plan table, until you see the **Edit** column. Under this column, click on the **Change Vehicle** text of the Delivery Shift you want to change vehicle
* Step 2: The **Change Vehicle** form will appear. On this form, click on the **to Vehicle** field. The drop-down list will show the vehicles that meet the following criteria:
* 1 - Are from the same Depot with the current vehicle
* 2 - Have the same **Vehicle Type** attribute with the current vehicle
* 3 - Have not been assigned any Delivery Shift on the same date with the current vehicle
* 4 - Have the Weight/Volume capacity to at least be equal to the Total Weight/Volume of the Orders on the Delivery Shift
* Step 3: Select the vehicle to which you want to reassign the Delivery Shift, then click **OK**

<Image title="Change Vehicle (English).gif" alt={1920} src="https://files.readme.io/5e0ef7f-Change_Vehicle_English.gif">
  Change Vehicle (English)
</Image>

<Image title="Change Vehicle (VIE).gif" alt={1920} src="https://files.readme.io/e4b5b27-Change_Vehicle_VIE.gif">
  Change Vehicle (Vietnamese)
</Image>

<Image title="TXWYJbh2mh.gif" alt={1920} className="border" border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/3e60222-TXWYJbh2mh.gif" />

## Change Driver of Planned Delivery Shift

* When the Planning Status of a particular Delivery Shift is still ***Planned***, not yet ***Locked***, you can assign another driver to operate the vehicle that is currently assigned that Delivery Shift. The detailed steps are described below:
* Step 1: Drag the horizontal scrollbar to the far right of the Route Plan table, until you see the **Edit** column. Under this column, click on the **Change Driver** text of the Delivery Trip you want to change driver
* Step 2: The **Change Driver** form will appear. On this form, click on the **New Driver** field. The drop-down list will show the drivers that meet the following criteria:
* 1 - Are from the same Depot with the current vehicle
* 2 - Have the Active Status to be ***Active*** (If the desired driver is currently inactive, you can change his status over at the **Transportation** > **Drivers** tab)
* 3 - Does not currently operate any other vehicle on the same date of that Route Plan
* Step 4: Select the driver to which you want to reassign the Delivery Shift, then click on **Change**

<Image title="flmWlbuuK8.gif" alt={1920} className="border" border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/43b348c-flmWlbuuK8.gif" />

## Move Order/Stop

* There are two situations in which you can move the Orders/Stops
* Situation 1: The Planning Status of a particular Delivery Shift of a vehicle is still ***Planned***, not yet ***Locked***. In this situation, you can move the Orders within a Stop, a whole Stop, or multiple Stops within the Delivery Trips of that Delivery Shift to another Delivery Trip of that same vehicle or the Planned Delivery Shift of other vehicles
* Situation 2: The Planning Status of a particular Delivery Shift of a vehicle is ***Locked***. In this situation, you can move the Orders within a Stop, a whole Stop, or multiple Stops ***only*** within that same Delivery Shift. You can not move the Orders/Stops in that Delivery Shift to other Delivery Shifts of other vehicles

### Move Orders within a single Stop

* To move the Orders within a single Stop, perform the steps below:
* Step 1: Click on the right angle icon **:fa-angle-right:** on the row containing the Vehicle Code to display the Delivery Shift assigned to that vehicle. Continue to click on the right angle icon :fa-angle-right: on the row of the Delivery Shift to display all Delivery Trips within that Delivery Shift
* Step 2: Scroll the horizontal scrollbar of the Route Plan table to the far-right until you see the column **Edit**. Under this column, click on the **Move Order/Stop** text of the Stop you want to move
* Step 3: The **Move Stop/Order** form will appear. On this form, first, you need to click on the **Orders** field. Upon clicking, a list will appear showing the Orders in that Stop. To select the Orders, click on their corresponding checkbox icons :fa-square-o:

> ðŸ“˜ Useful tip
>
> By default, when opening this form, you can see that none of the Orders on a Stop is selected. That also equals to all Orders on that Stop are selected, so if you initially intend to select all Orders, you don't need to manually select each Order

* Step 4: After the Orders have been selected, click on the **to Vehicle** field. Upon clicking, a drop-down list will appear showing the vehicles which:
* 1. Have also been utilized within that same Route Plan, **and** 
* 2. Have the Delivery Trips still in ***Planned***, not yet ***Locked*** status. Select the vehicle to which you want to move the selected Orders
* Step 5: After the vehicle has been selected, click on the **to Trip** field. The drop-down list will show the available Delivery Trips of the selected vehicle. Select the appropriate Delivery Trip from that list
* Step 6: After the Delivery Trip has been selected, click on the field **to Before Position**. The drop-down list will show the appropriate Stops on the selected Delivery Trip that you can move the Orders to. Select the appropriate position before which you want to move the selected Orders
* Step 7: Click on the **Move** button
* The system will immediately move the selected Orders/Stop to the position you intended

<Image title="move order route plan.gif" alt={1916} className="border" border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/8c7d939-move_order_route_plan.gif" />

### Move multiple Stops

* To move multiple Stops at once, follow the steps below:
* Step 1: Click the respective checkbox icons :fa-square-o: of the Stops you want to move to select them
* **Note**: If you initially select a Stop that belongs to a Planned Delivery Trip, you can only continue to select other Stops that also belong to that Planned Delivery Trips or the Planned Delivery Trips of other vehicles. On the other hand, if you initially select a Stop in a Locked Delivery Trip, you can only continue to select Stops within that Locked Delivery Trip

> ðŸ“˜ Useful Tips
>
> As you select a Stop, the system will display a message above the Route Plan table to indicate whether the Stop you have selected belongs to a Planned Delivery Trip or a Locked Delivery Trip

<Image title="yWktOWjgSN.png" alt={1158} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/514438b-yWktOWjgSN.png">
  Message when the selected Stops are in a Planned Delivery Trip
</Image>

<Image title="AJ7OAXmX0y.png" alt={1161} border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/9efeff1-AJ7OAXmX0y.png">
  Message when the selected Stops are in a Locked Delivery Trip
</Image>

* Step 2: After you have selected the wanted Stops, click the **Move** button located above the top right corner of the Route Plan table. The **Move Stop** panel will appear on the right side of the screen
* Step 3: On the Move Stop panel, the selected Stops will appear below the **Selected** text. If you accidentally selected unwanted Stops, click the respective remove icons :fa-trash: of those Stops to remove them. On the other hand, if you want to add more Stops, you can continue to click the checkbox icons :fa-square-o: of the Stops on the Route Plan table as described above
* Step 4: Next, click on the **Vehicle** field to select the vehicle to which you want to move the selected Stops. The drop-down list will show two types of vehicles: 
* 1. The vehicles which have also been utilized in that same Route Plan (Normal black text), **and** 
* 2. The vehicles which have not yet been utilized in that Route Plan (Bold blue text with the ***- empty*** suffix). If the selected Stops belong to not yet locked Delivery Trips, you can select any vehicle you want. On the other hand, if the selected Stops belong to a locked Delivery Trip, you can only select the current vehicle (Even though the drop-down list will still show other vehicles)
* Step 5: After you have selected the vehicle, click on the **Shift** field to select the Delivery Shift of the selected vehicle on which you want to move the selected Stops. Next, click on the **After Position** field to select the position on the selected Delivery Shift, after which you want to move the selected Stops
* Step 6: Finally, click **Move**. After a short while, the system will move the selected Stops to your intended position

## Remove Order/Stop from Planned Delivery Trip

* If a Delivery Shift of a vehicle is still in ***Planned***, not yet ***Locked***, status, then you can remove Orders within a Stop, a whole Stop, or multiple Stops of that Delivery Shift from the current Route Plan

### Remove Orders within a Stop

* To remove a particular Order or a whole Stop from the Delivery Route of a vehicle, follow the steps below:
* Step 1: Scroll to the far right of the Route Plan table
* Step 2: Click on the **Remove Order/Stop** text (Under the **Edit** column) of the wanted Stop
* Step 3: The **Remove Stop/Order** form will appear
* Step 4: On this form, you need to click on the **Orders** field to select the Orders to remove. If a Stop has multiple Orders, you can select just one Order, select several Orders or select all Orders (Which equals to selecting the whole Stop)
* Step 5: After the Orders have been selected, click on the **Remove** button
* The system will remove the selected Orders from the current Route Plan and treat them as [**Unplanned (Missing) Orders**](https://docs.abivin.com/docs/vrp-in-house-fleet-route-plan-list-view#section-unplanned-orders)

<Image title="remove orders route plan.gif" alt={1916} className="border" border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/ca15440-remove_orders_route_plan.gif" />

### Remove multiple Stops

* To remove multiple Stops from the Route Plan, follow the steps below
* Step 1: Click the respective checkbox icons :fa-square-o: of the wanted Stops to select them
* Step 2: Click the **Remove** button above the top right corner of the Route Plan table.
* After a few moments, the Orders within the removed Stops will become Unplanned (Missing) Orders and will appear on the Unplanned Orders panel

## Move Unplanned (Missing) Orders back to Delivery Route

> ðŸ“˜ Unplanned Orders on Route Plan (List View) are the same as Missing Orders on Route Plan (Map View). From now on, we will refer to them as ***Unplanned (Missing) Orders*** to minimize confusion

* Unplanned (Missing) Orders are
* 1. Orders that the system doesn't automatically put into the optimized Delivery Routes during the Route Plan optimization process due to various reasons **or** 
* 2. Orders that the system has put into the optimized Delivery Routes during the Route Plan Optimization, but the dispatchers manually remove out of the optimized Delivery Routes afterward
* If there are Unplanned (Missing) Orders during the Route Plan Optimization process, then a button titled **Unplanned Orders** will appear on the toolbar, next to the **Map View** button. To view the list of the Unplanned (Missing) Orders of a Route Plan, click on that button. The **Unplanned Orders** panel will appear on the right side of the screen
* On this panel, the Unplanned (Missing) Orders are grouped by Stops. Click on a Stop will show the Unplanned (Missing) Orders of that Stop. To know the reason why the system treats a particular Order as an Unplanned (Missing)  Order, click on its Order Code
* Here, you can perform the following actions: 
* 1. Move a single Unplanned (Missing) Order back to the Route Plan **or** 
* 2. Move a whole Stop or multiple Stops back to the Route Plan

### Move a single Unplanned (Missing) Order back to the Route Plan

* Follow the steps below to move a single Unplanned (Missing) Orders back to the Route Plan:
* Step 1: Click on the four arrows icon :fa-arrows: of the Unplanned (Missing) Order you want to move
* Step 2: The system will display a confirmation message asking if you want to move that Unplanned (Missing) Order. Click ***OK*** on that message to proceed
* Step 3: The **Move Order into Trip** form will appear
* Step 4: On this form, first you need to click on the field **to Vehicle**. Upon clicking, a drop-down list will show two types of vehicles: 1. Vehicles that have also been utilized in that same Route Plan (Normal black text) and 2. Vehicles that have not been used in that Route Plan (Bold blue text with the ***- empty*** suffix). Click on the vehicle to which you want to move the Unplanned (Missing) Order
* Step 4.1: If the selected vehicle has already been used in that Route Plan, two more fields **to Trip** and **to Before Position** will appear. Click on the **to Trip** field and select the Delivery Trip of the selected vehicle to where you want to move the Unplanned (Missing) Order. Next, click on the **to Before Position** field and select the position on the selected Delivery Trip to before where you want to move the Unplanned (Missing) Order
* Step 5: Finally, click on **Move**. After a few moments, the system will move the Unplanned (Missing) Order to the intended position
* **Note**: If on the selected vehicle's Delivery Route there already exists a Stop of the same customer as that of the Unplanned (Missing) Order, then the system will move the Unplanned (Missing) Order right into the Stop of that customer

<Image title="move unplanned order.gif" alt={1916} className="border" border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/28d806c-move_unplanned_order.gif" />

### Move a whole Stop or multiple Stops back to the Route Plan

* To move a whole Stop or multiple Stops back to the Route Plan, follow the steps below:
* Step 1: On the Unplanned Orders panel, click the respective checkbox icons :fa-square-o: of the Stops you want to move to select them
* Step 2: After you have selected the Stops, click the **Move** button at the bottom of the panel
* Step 3: The **Move Stop** panel will appear to the right side of the Unplanned Orders panel
* Step 4: On this panel, if you see that you have accidentally selected unwanted Stops, you can remove those unwanted Stops by clicking their respective remove icons :fa-trash:
* Step 5: After removing the unwanted Stops, click on the **Vehicle** field. Upon clicking, a drop-down list will show two types of vehicles: 1. Vehicles that have also been utilized in that same Route Plan (Normal black text) and 2. Vehicles that have not been used in that Route Plan (Bold blue text with the ***- empty*** suffix). Click on the vehicle to which you want to move the Unplanned (Missing) Order
* Step 5.1: If the selected vehicle has already been used in that Route Plan, the **Shift** field will appear below. Click on this field and select the Delivery Shift of the selected vehicle to where you want to move the selected Stops
* Step 5.2: After the Delivery Shift has been selected, the **After Position** field will appear below. Click on this field and select the position on the selected Delivery Shift after where you want to move the selected Stops
* Step 6: Finally, click on **Move**. After a few moments, the system will move the selected Stops to the intended position

## Manually Split Orders on locked Delivery Routes

* If the current Planning Status of a particular Delivery Trip is ***Locked***, then you can manually split the Orders on that Delivery Trip into smaller Orders
* To do that, follow the steps below:
* Step 1: Click on the Order Code of the wanted Order (Under the **Order Codes** column). When the form **Split Order** appears, follow the steps that have been described at the article [**Manage Sales Orders**](https://docs.abivin.com/docs/vrp-in-house-fleet-manage-sales-orders#manually-split-order)

<Image title="FMktFMGClP.gif" alt={1911} className="border" border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/e930ee7-FMktFMGClP.gif" />

## Route Plan description

## Show Whole Route Plan

* To show the whole Route Plan, instead of having to tediously show each Delivery Shift, you can simply click 

<Image title="show whole route plan.gif" alt={1920} className="border" border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/b39615f-show_whole_route_plan.gif" />

## Sort Delivery Trips

* On the Route Plan list, you can sort the Delivery Trips by the following parameters: **Vehicle Type; License Plate; Capacity; Driver; Shift Code; Customer Name**. To sort by a particular parameter, hover over the respective column title. You'll see the up arrow icon :fa-arrow-up:. Click on that icon will sort the Delivery Trip list in ascending order. Click on that icon one more time will make it change to down arrow icon :fa-arrow-down:, meaning the Delivery Trip list will be sorted in descending order

<Image title="sortlistview.gif" alt={1920} className="border" border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/db0d58a-sortlistview.gif" />

## View and Export Route Plan Documents

## Store and Export Route Plan Versions

* Each time the dispatcher performs an adjustment to the Route Plan, whether right in the Route Plan (Such as changing driver, changing vehicle) or to any object of the Route Plan (Products, Customer etc.) and click the button **Optimize** again, the system will store a record of the Route Plan at that moment. That record is defined as the **Route Plan version**
* On the Route Plan screen, the Route Plan versions can be accessed via the button **Original Route Plans**, located on the toolbar above the Route Plan table
* The number on the top right of the button indicates the version numbers of the Route Plan that have been created to date

<Image title="06XH6fN1Eo.png" alt={175} className="border" border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/ba7450a-06XH6fN1Eo.png" />

* Upon clicking the button, the form **Original Route Plans** will appear on the right side of the screen. Here you will be able to view all versions of the Route Plan to date. The versions are sorted in chronological order, with the latest version on the top of the list, and the oldest version at the bottom. The column **Planning Version** shows the names of the versions; the column **Planned by** shows the Username of the User who optimized a certain Route Plan version; the column **Planning Time** shows the time stamp a version was created
* To export a version of the Route Plan, click the corresponding download icon :fa-arrow-down: of that version. That version will be immediately exported as an Excel spreadsheet to view offline

<Image title="export rp.gif" alt={1916} className="border" border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/102c99d-export_rp.gif" />

## Search & Filter Route Plans

## Search Route Plans

### Search Route Plans by creation dates

* You can search Route Plans created within a maximum date range of maximum ***ninety days***. To do that, click the calendar icon :fa-calendar:, then select the appropriate date range from the popout calendar

<Image title="5iEZMOLvr8.png" alt={804} className="border" border={true} src="https://files.readme.io/84374d3-5iEZMOLvr8.png" />

### Search within Route Plans

* Within a Route Plan, you can use the search bar located above the top left corner of the Delivery Shift table to search for specific Delivery Shifts/Delivery Trips within that Route Plan. You can search by the following attributes: **Customer Name; Customer Address; Order Code; Planning Status; Sync Status; Vehicle Name; License Plate; Shift Code; Trip Code**

## Filter within Route Plans

### Filter by Vehicles

* You can filter the Delivery Shifts assigned to a specific vehicle by clicking on the **Vehicle** box (Located to the right of the search bar) then select the desired vehicle from the drop-down list. You can also input the Vehicle Name/License Plate of the vehicle into the search bar of that box to filter out faster

### Filter by Planning Status

### Filter by Sync Status
